post.body: no, not single turbines, but the giant nodal grid hub that the individual turbines collect into (like the SCE grid)
fair, but I feel that's often the case w/ advanced technology. Would a pickens grid not be giant national security target?
but nuclear could be a technological bridge, to some super clean tech, ala super fighters giving way to UAV's & satelites, no?
safety arguments in early life-cycle of technologies are pretty commonly overcome (air travel, space, medicine, etc)
if France can figure out a storage plan, I'm pretty certain we can too...I mean really, driving through W TX now. Put it here
Don't think lack of storage plan is reason not to build robust nuke pwr. There wasn't gasoline or elec/tele grid in 1900 either
ok, New Mexico too ;)
I disagree. I think nuclear is the answer for now & longterm. And as far as storage, why else do we have territories? ;)
shazam, Brightkite, Facebook, myspace, google, then all the free games for your boys to play...
Hey Jeremy! Saw on F/B that you're from MI tech? My cousin went to school there! Crazy winters, huh? Are you from MI?
